availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thornton F. Marshall (Augusta, Kentucky, attorney and politician)

body.p: Augusta, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Anna Eliza Mackie Marshall on October 11, 1841. Father of Mariah Marshall. Admitted to the bar in 1842. Attorney in Augusta in 1850 and 1860. County attorney for Bracken County, Kentucky, from 1851 to 1859. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Mason County from 1859 to 1863. Owned four enslaved persons in 1860. Delegate to the Democratic Convention in Chicago, Illinois, in 1864.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Augusta, p. 455; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Augusta, p. 6; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Augusta, p. 141; Kentucky, County Marriages, 1783-1965, Ancestry, Bracken County, Kentucky, October 11, 1841; Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1878), 93; H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 184; "Thornton F. Marshall Dead," _Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), March 26, 1901, p. 3.
